title: Update regarding BlockChain
story_body:
In a routine update, BlockChain Inc (BLK) announced several personnel changes within its Denver office, which employs approximately 150 staff members. The company has named a new regional sales manager, who will oversee a team of 20 account executives serving clients across the Rocky Mountain region.

Separately, BLK's marketing team launched a targeted campaign to promote its blockchain-based supply chain solutions to local businesses in the Portland metropolitan area. The initiative, dubbed "PDX Transparency," aims to highlight the benefits of increased visibility and accountability in the region's thriving food truck industry.

On the environmental, social, and governance (ESG) front, BLK's Seattle-based sustainability team has been working closely with the city's mayor's office to explore potential applications of blockchain technology in reducing carbon emissions from the city's transportation sector. The collaboration, which began in early 2022, has yielded several promising pilot projects, including a blockchain-based platform for tracking and verifying the carbon offset credits generated by the city's fleet of electric buses.

In Austin, where BLK maintains a significant presence, the company has been actively engaging with local community groups to promote diversity and inclusion in the tech industry. As part of this effort, BLK has partnered with the Austin chapter of the National Society of Black Engineers to provide mentorship and career development opportunities to underrepresented students and young professionals.

These updates reflect BLK's ongoing commitment to building strong relationships with the local communities in which it operates, while continuing to drive innovation and growth in the blockchain space.
